articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: CELTIC’S double winner Matt O’Riley will miss OUT on next month’s Euro 24 Finals in Germany. However, we still believed O’Riley had contributed enough to earn a place in his adopted [...]
articles.title: SHOCKER AS O’RILEY MISSES OUT

articles.author: Paul67
articles.description: They all move on eventually but suggestions that Kyogo (29) will head to Urawa Red Diamonds in Japan this summer are fanciful. The player is at the peak of his powers and has just finished a season when he scored crucial goals against Newco that swung the most important games of the term, as well [...]
articles.title: Kyogo is not a cheap diamond

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: MATT O’RILEY is poised to take centre stage in next month’s Euro 24 Finals when transfer speculation is bound to be ramped up. The 23-year-old stylish midfielder is heading for the soccer extravaganza after a memorable season at double-winning Celtic. O’Riley, who swept up the club’s Player of the Year awards, also shared the distinction of [...]
articles.title: O’RILEY POISED FOR EURO 24 SPOTLIGHT

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: BRENDAN RODGERS is stepping up his goalkeeper chase as he seeks TWO new shotstoppers at the champions. Joe Hart, at the age of 37 and after three glorious years at Parkhead, has retired following his last-ever appearance in the 1-0 Scottish Cup Final at Hampden at the weekend. Benji Siegrist, 31, has not figured at [...]
articles.title: RODGERS STEPS UP KEEPER CHASE

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: OH HYEON-GYU looks to be heading for the exit as he leads a Celtic clear-out. The South Korean striker, bought by Ange Postecoglou for £2million in January 2022, has become a bit-part player since the arrival of Brendan Rodgers last June. Oh, 23, has made just three league starts in his 20 appearances this season [...]
articles.title: OH LEADS CELTIC CLEAR-OUT

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: CELTIC could more than DOUBLE their money if they are tempted to allow Kyogo Furuhashi to leave the champions this summer. Reports have emerged that J-League giants Urawa Red Diamonds are preparing an ambitious record-breaking bid to take the striker back to Japan. The Hoops paid Vissel Kobe £4.6million for the 29-year-old fans’ favourite in July [...]
articles.title: KYOGO: DOUBLE YOUR MONEY

articles.author: Paul67
articles.description: Claims that Newco dominated the Scottish Cup Final (made by formerly credible outlets) are clearly untrue, but although Celtic shaded all the important metrics, there was little between the sides. We had the ability to get the better of Newco in tight games all season.  Brendan Rodgers will be happy with this, but Philippe Clement [...]
articles.title: Rodgers and Clement will both be encouraged

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: CALLUM McGREGOR has urged Celtic to snap up Paulo Bernardo in the summer. The Hoops skipper admits he has been impressed by the on-loan Benfica playmaker who is valued around the £6.3million mark by the Lisbon giants. Bernardo, 22, has made 33 appearances in the Hoops’ double-winning season to welcome back Brendan Rodgers back to the [...]
articles.title: ‘IMPORTANT,’ McGREGOR CALL FOR BERNARDO DEAL

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: ADAM IDAH’S valuation appears to have TREBLED in his four months of action at Celtic. The figure of £3million was originally mentioned when the 23-year-old Norwich City bit-part player arrived at Parkhead in a loan deal on January deadline day. Idah has scored nine goals over the period, including, of course, the last-minute Scottish Cup winner against Philippe [...]
articles.title: ALEX’S ANGLE: IDAH, JOTA, JOHNSTON AND THE MULTI-MILLION POUND MERRY-GO-ROUND

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: CELTIC took their first steps onto the football pitch at their recently-completed ground for an intriguing fund-raising encounter on Monday, May 28 1888. Neil McCallum scored the club’s first-ever goal after ten minutes in a 5-2 victory over Rangers. In a crowd of around 2,000 spectators, the males paid sixpence each to witness the spectacle. [...]
articles.title: CELTIC AND THEIR FIRST STEPS TO GLORY

articles.description: Claims like ‘World’s most successful football club’ are meaningless to most football fans, as the vast majority are not attached to a club which can make such a boast.  We are more concerned about who is winning and the direction of travel at our club. When Newco made a totem of this claim by plastering [...]

articles.description: Recency bias is powerful.  We remember and place more emphasis on things which happened most recently compared to things which happened before that.  The time period between the recent event and what went before is not important. Play poorly for 75 minutes and end the game with a strong 15 minutes and, if you have [...]
